div.byline: By Mr. BAXTER, and the Worcester-Shire Ministers.

Amen.

Obey them that have the Rule over you, and submit your selves: For they watch for your Souls, as they that must give Account; that they may do it with Joy, and not with Grief; for that is unprofitable for you. And let us consider one another, to provoke unto Love and to Good Works: Not forsaking the Assembling of Ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: That ye may with One Mind and One Mouth glorify God even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

div.head: ADVERTISEMENT.
div.p: THE foregoing Paper was first found by the present Editor, in M. S. in the Study of a Private Christian, fair • y written, with the Proofs. It since • ppears to be Part of the Worcester-shire Agreement, contain'd at large in Mr. Baxter's Christian Concord; to which all, especially Learned Readers, are referr'd for the Occasion, large Explanation, and Vindication of it. 'Twas design'd by these Ministers to be the Foundation of a Regular Discipline in their Parishes in 1653; and is now printed for the sake of some that use it according to the Title it here bears. 'Tis recited also in Mr. Baxter's Confession of Faith.
